result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence L. Bruton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:29 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF926, 14CM2364 & 15CM91**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Richard Lawson. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State moves to amend CC with the following:
14CF926- Delete repeater enhancer and delete use of a dangerous weapon enhancer on Ct.1, delete repeater enhancer on Ct.2 and delete repeater enhancer and use of a dangerous weapon enhancer on Ct.3.
14CM2364- Delete repeater enhancer on all counts. 
COURT GRANTS. 
State further moves to: 
14CF926- DRI Ct.2- Battery (Domestic Abuse) & DRI Ct.3- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)
14CM2364- DRI Ct.5- Battery (Domestic Abuse), DRI Ct.6- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), DRI Ct.7- Battery (Domestic Abuse) & DRI Ct.8- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)
15CM91- DRI Ct.1- Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order-Injunction
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF926- Ct.1- False Imprisonment (Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST by claim of innocence (Alford Plea)
           14CM2364- Ct.1- Battery (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
                                Ct.2- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
                                Ct.3- Battery (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
                                Ct.4- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF926- Ct.1- 5 years WI State Prison System, 2 years IC & 3 years ES concurrent to all other jail/prison sentences. Defendant is entitled to 185 days credit. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete SAFE program or equivalent program, no contact with D.B., participate in any counseling and programming as deemed appropriate by agent, CC & DNA surcharge. 
                             14CM2364- Ct.1- 9 months MCJ with 185 days credit concurrent to all other jail/prison sentences. 
                                                  Ct.2- 90 days MCJ with 90 days credit concurrent to all other jail/prison sentences.
                                                  Ct.3- 9 months MCJ with 185 days credit concurrent to all other jail/prison sentences.
                                                  Ct.4- 90 days MCJ with 90 days credit concurrent to all other jail/prison sentences. 
Defendant remanded to MCSD for transport to WI State Prison System. Defendant is not eligible for CIP/SAP.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 2:52 p.m. 
**Includes 14CF926, 14CM2364 & 15CM91**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Atty Peter Karoblis. 
Date & time set for Motion Hearing. Atty Karoblis requests to withdraw as Atty. 
COURT GRANTS. COURT appoints Atty Richard Lawson at the same rate as previous order with the exception of a $2,000.00 cap. 
Atty Karoblis to discuss matter with Atty Lawson. 
CC- January 20th, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. in Br.2.  
Adj: 2:56 p.m.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:10 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF926, 14CM2364 & 15CM91**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Atty Peter Karoblis. 
Date & time set for Motion Hearing in 14CF926. 14CM2364 & 15CM91 are tracking. 
Atty Karoblis makes statement regarding motions that have been filed and is contesting joinder. COURT FINDS joinder is appropriate. Court questions the amount of time set for JT and if 1 day is sufficient. Atty Puerner & Atty Karoblis agree 1 day should be sufficient, however trial might run into the next day. 
COURT addresses motions. OTR: 10:18 a.m. BOTR: 10:19 a.m. State objects to motions filed on January 5th, 2015 and makes argument. Atty Karoblis makes statement. State objects to motions filed on January 8th, 2015 and also makes argument. Atty Karoblis argues reasoning for motions and validity. COURT asks State to ask victim to provide clothing for defendant at time of trial. Atty Karoblis would like defendant's credit card used the night of the incident. State does not object to Atty Karoblis obtaining defendant's credit card and will look into location of credit card. 
COURT DENIES motions. State to file any Motions in Limine and motions will be addressed the day of trial. 
JT set for January 27th, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. in Br.2 for 14CF926 & 14CM2364. 
Parties to set another date for Motions in Limine with JA. 
Adj: 10:34 a.m.

AMENDED
Peter Karoblis
